result.execSummary:
The defendant Courtland Quenton Love was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of a Firearm by a Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>3-10g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)2.
  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>40g) [Modifiers: Second or Subsequent Offense], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)4.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:  all court costs, fees, and surcharges including DNA; all applicable fees of supervision.
Court ordered that all court costs, fines, and surcharges be paid through collection from any Court ordered obligations from the defendant's prison funds in an amount or percentage determined by DOC and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with  count three and case 12CF498.  Consecutive to count two and case 16CF2890.  Credit for 536 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
No alcohol.  No drugs.
No possession, consumption, selling, distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
No possession of drug delivery property: corner cuts, scales, multiple cell phones, etc.
Court ordered defendant may not possess $100.00 or more in cash at any given time.
No contact with drug users or locations where illegal substances  are trafficked or consumed.

Any other programs designated by the Department.
Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
AODA assessment and cooperae with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department. Absolute/maintain sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING (EXCERPT OF PROCEEDINGS) Transcript (17 pages) commencing MARCH 2, 2018 received and filed.
3/7/18 bail refund notice/affidavit mailed to surety.

Defendant Courtland Quenton Love in court with attorney Robin Shellow.  Megan Marie Newport appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in Court for Sentencing Hearing. Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the Defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 82 MONTHS, with credit for 536 DAYS, CONCURRENT TO COUNT 3 and Case 12CF498, CONSECUTIVE TO COUNT 2 and Case 16CF2890; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 46 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 36 MONTHS.

AS TO COUNT 2: The Court sentenced the Defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 36 MONTHS, CONCURRENT TO COUNT 3 and Case 12CF498, CONSECUTIVE TO COUNT 1 and Case 16CF2890; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 18 MONTHS.

AS TO COUNT 3: The Court sentenced the Defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 36 MONTHS, CONCURRENT to COUNTS 1 and 2, and Case 12CF498; CONSECUTIVE TO Case 16CF2890; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 18 MONTHS.

Court finds Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
Random urine screens.
No possession of drug delivery property (corner cuts, scales, multiple cell phones, etc).
Court ordered Defendant may not possess $100.00 or more in cash at any given time. 
No contact with known drug users or locations where illegal substances are trafficked or consumed. 
Obtain/maintain full-time employment.
Any other programs designated by the Department.
Provide a DNA sample.
Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
Court ordered that all court costs, fines, and surcharges be paid through collection from any court ordered obligations from the Defendant's prison funds in an amount or percentage determined by DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised Defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised Defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised Defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

20 day appeal rights given.

Defendant Courtland Quenton Love in court with attorney Robin Shellow.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Megan Williamson.  AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, & 3:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant  examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   Pursuant to negotiations Count 4 is dismissed but will be read in at sentencing.  Court ordered a presentence investigation report.  Case remains calendared in Br. 24 for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 8, 2017 at 08:30 am.
